text: In another successful anti-piracy operation , Navy warship on Saturday repulsed an attack on a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden and nabbed 23 Somali and Yemeni sea brigands , in a show of resolve to weed out the menace that affected maritime trade in the region .
marked_sentence: In another successful anti-piracy operation , Navy warship on Saturday repulsed an attack on a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden and nabbed 23 Somali and Yemeni sea brigands , in a show of <mark id="mark_id"> resolve </mark> to weed out the menace that affected maritime trade in the region .
marked_doc: In another successful anti-piracy operation , Navy warship on Saturday repulsed an attack on a merchant vessel in the Gulf of Aden and nabbed 23 Somali and Yemeni sea brigands , in a show of <mark id="mark_id"> resolve </mark> to weed out the menace that affected maritime trade in the region . <p/>The pirates on two speed boats had surrounded the merchant vessel flying the Ethiopian flag around noon , when INS Mysore warship intervened and warded off the attack , Navy spokesperson said . <p/>The pirates had fired at the merchant vessel with their small arms , when it sent out a rescue call and the Indian warship , which was sailing nearby moved its Marine Commandos on a helicopter to help the distressed cargo vessel , he said . <p/>The attack took place about 150 nautical miles off Aden and INS Mysore was about 13 nautical miles away from the merchant vessel when it picked up the SOS call . <p/>The Navy flew its Marine Commandos on helicopters to the scene of the pirate attack and rescued the ship. MV Gibe was later escorted to safety , he added . <p/>The Naval commandos also boarded the pirates ' boats and seized seven AK-47 assault rifles , two other rifles , a grenade launcher and 13 fully loaded magazines of ammunition from the 12 Somali and 11 Yemeni pirates on board the two pirate boats . <p/>Further search for other pirates , who fled from the spot following the Indian Naval intervention , was in progress , the spokesperson said . <p/>Last month , Navy warship INS Tabar , a missile-frigate , had sunk a mother ship of the pirates and had also rescued two merchant vessels that were under attack from the sea brigands . <p/>After the successful counter attack on the pirates , INS Mysore later escorted MV Gibe to safety , the Navy spokesperson said . <p/>It also launched further search for some of the pirates who escaped after the launch of the marine commando operation . <p/>Indian Navy has also sought assistance from warships of other countries deployed on anti-piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden to catch the runaway brigands , he said . <p/>New Delhi had taken a serious view of piracy-related incidents in the Gulf of Aden , the primary sea lane for global maritime trade to and fro oil-rich West Asia , following the abduction of MV Stolt Valor , which had 18 Indian sailors on board , by Somali pirates from the region on September 15 , 2008 . <p/>On October 23 , India gave a go-ahead to the Navy 's request for a pro-active approach to counter the outlaws operating with audacity in the region along the Horn of Africa . <p/>The Navy rushed its stealth frigate INS Tabar , which was already deployed nearby to Gulf of Aden on November 2 and since then it rescued an Indian vessel MV Jag Arnav and a Saudi cargo ship on November 11 and also sunk a pirate `mother ship ' on November 19 . <p/>The 'first kill ' , as Navy Chief Admiral Sureesh Mehta had later described the sinking , turned out to be a Thai fishing trawler under the pirates ' control carrying a lot of ammunition and it went up in flames after INS Tabar fired at it in retaliation .

Ann1 chose resolve.02
Ann2 chose resolve.01

text: Commandos from an Indian warship today caught pirates in the act in the Gulf of Aden and took 23 of them into custody , a spokesperson at naval headquarters said .
marked_sentence: Commandos from an Indian warship today <mark id="mark_id"> caught </mark> pirates in the act in the Gulf of Aden and took 23 of them into custody , a spokesperson at naval headquarters said .
marked_doc: Commandos from an Indian warship today <mark id="mark_id"> caught </mark> pirates in the act in the Gulf of Aden and took 23 of them into custody , a spokesperson at naval headquarters said . <p/>Indian naval ship Mysore , a destroyer , picked up a distress call from merchant vessel Gibe , which flies an Ethiopian flag , when it was 13 nautical miles ( about 24km ) from the cargo ship . <p/>Details of what exactly happened are still awaited . <p/>The Gibe was about 150 nautical miles ( about 277km ) from Aden when the pirates , said to be in a dhow or fishing vessel named Salaluddin , fired at it and tried to board it , according to information available now . <p/>Two speedboats suspected to be carrying more pirates were approaching the Gibe . <p/>The navy spokesperson said marine commandos from the Mysore flew in the destroyer 's embarked helicopter , boarded the Salaluddin and caught 12 Somalis and 11 Yemenis . <p/>They also confiscated seven AK-47s , a 5.56mm and a 7.62mm rifles , a grenade launcher , three outboard motors ( used to power dinghies or inflatable rafts ) , a handheld global positioning system and mobile phones . <p/>The pirates in the speedboats fled . <p/>The Mysore is tasked to patrol a 480-nautical-mile corridor from Bab-el-Mandab in the west to the mouth of the Gulf of Aden . <p/>It is required to be in touch with merchant vessels within a 15-nautical-mile radius at all times . <p/>Last month , marine commandos from INS Tabar were reported to have rescued two cargo vessels that were being attacked . <p/>Later , the Tabar fired at and sank a Thai trawler that the Indian Navy said was a pirate `` mother vessel '' . <p/>The Mysore will eventually replace the Tabar in patrolling the Gulf of Aden and off the coast of Somalia . <p/>A much larger ship than the frigate , the Mysore was deployed because it is capable of staying out at sea longer without having to replenish frequently .

Ann1 chose catch.03
Ann2 chose catch.01

text: Taking the lead in the fight against piracy , the Indian Navy on Saturday arrested 23 Somali pirates .
marked_sentence: <mark id="mark_id"> Taking the lead </mark> in the fight against piracy , the Indian Navy on Saturday arrested 23 Somali pirates .
marked_doc: <mark id="mark_id"> Taking the lead </mark> in the fight against piracy , the Indian Navy on Saturday arrested 23 Somali pirates . <p/>An Indian warship , INS Mysore deployed in the Gulf of Aden attacked two boats of pirates after receiving signals from a ship that the pirates were trying to hijack . <p/>The Indian warship was patrolling in the Somali waters when it rushed to rescue MV Gibe , a merchant vessel flying the Ethiopian flag . <p/>The pirates on two speed boats had surrounded the merchant vessel , when INS Mysore warship intervened and warded off the attack , Navy spokesperson said here . <p/>The pirates had fired at the merchant vessel with their small arms , when it sent out a rescue call and the Indian warship , which was sailing nearby moved its Marine Commandos on an helicopter to help the distressed cargo vessel , he said . <p/>The attack took place about 150 nautical miles off Aden and INS Mysore was about 13 nautical miles away from the merchant vessel when it picked up the SOS call . <p/>The Navy flew its Marine Commandos on helicopters to the scene of the pirate attack and rescued the ship. MV Gibe was later escorted to safety , he added . <p/>The Indian commandos also recovered 12 AK 47 guns , three rifles , two grenades along with other ammunition . <p/>Out of 23 arrested pirates , 12 are reportedly from Somalia and 11 from Yemen . <p/>The Indian warship , the INS Mysore , was dispatched to the Gulf of Aden after a spike in piracy and hijackings off the coast of Somalia , which is caught up in an Islamic insurgency and has had no functioning government since 1991 .

text: Indian Naval Ship Interdicts Three Pirate Vessels In A Single Operation
marked_sentence: Indian Naval Ship <mark id="mark_id"> Interdicts </mark> Three Pirate Vessels In A Single Operation
marked_doc: http : / / www . freerepublic . com / focus / f - news / 2807784 / posts <p/>Indian Naval Ship <mark id="mark_id"> Interdicts </mark> Three Pirate Vessels In A Single Operation <p/>Posted on November 15 , 2011 6 : 07 : 15 PM GMT+01 : 0 <p/>Indian Naval Ship Sukanya , presently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command , found herself once again in the thick of things , thwarting a multiple - boat piracy attack on 10 Nov 11 . <p/>The ship was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the IRTC ( Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor ) when , at about 9 : 25 in the morning of 10th Nov , she detected a group of five suspicious boats , speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group . <p/>The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them . <p/>On seeing the resolve evident in the warship ’ s action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments , the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area . <p/>While two of them managed to get away , the Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three and carried out well practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action . <p/>The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew onboard . <p/>During the operation , six AK 47 rifles , 12 Magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated . <p/>In addition , the boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels , ladders and rope - handling gloves all of which confirmed their piratical intent . <p/>The timely operation by Sukanya resulted , once again , in foiling the pirates ’ intention of attacking merchant vessels transiting this busy sea lane through which over a hundred Billion Dollars of India ’ s external trade passes each year . <p/>This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by Sukanya , in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden , which commenced in September . <p/>The ship has , thus far , confiscated a total of 14 AK 47 Rifles , 31 Magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition , thereby ensuring that the Indian Navy retains its standing as a force not to be trifled with , and remains at the forefront of anti - piracy operations , as a critical component of the international effort to curb piracy and ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade , even in this highly risk - prone area .
user_input:
Ann1 chose interdict.01
Ann2 chose intercept.01

text: A five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden was foiled by an Indian warship that was on escort duty , capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons , a naval officer said here Friday .
marked_sentence: A five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden was foiled by an Indian warship that was <mark id="mark_id"> on escort duty </mark> , capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons , a naval officer said here Friday .
marked_doc: http : / / www . bharatwaves . co . in / news / Indian - Navy - foils - another - piracy - attempt - - 26046 . html <p/>A five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden was foiled by an Indian warship that was <mark id="mark_id"> on escort duty </mark> , capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons , a naval officer said here Friday . <p/>Patrol vessel INS Sukanya was escorting the five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor in the Gulf of Aden Thursday morning when the warship's crew noticed the five - boat pirate formation approaching the cargo ship group . <p/>"The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them , " the officer said , adding the pirate skiffs then reversed course and tried to flee the area . <p/>"While two of the skiffs and its crew managed to get away , Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three skiffs and carried out well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action . <p/>"The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew on board . <p/>During the operation , six AK - 47 rifles , 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated , " the officer said . <p/>In addition , the naval boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels , ladders and rope - handling gloves , all of which confirmed their intent to attack and hijack the merchant vessels , he said . <p/>This anti - piracy action by INS Sukanya was the fifth successful operation by its crew during its current patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden since September this year . <p/>INS Sukanya has seized a total of 14 AK - 47 rifles , 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition during the five operations it carried out there , the officer said .

text: The man accused of shooting his three former co - workers is Anthony LaCalamita III , a 38 - year - old Troy resident who was fired from Gordon Advisors on Thursday .
marked_sentence: The man accused of <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> his three former co - workers is Anthony LaCalamita III , a 38 - year - old Troy resident who was fired from Gordon Advisors on Thursday .
marked_doc: http : / / www . foxnews . com / story / 2007 / 04 / 11 / detroit - office - shooter - charged - with - murder - attempted - murder / <p/>Detroit Office Shooter Charged With Murder , Attempted Murder <p/>Published April 11 , 2007 <p/>A man fired four days earlier from his job as an accountant walked into his old office , passed by the receptionist and made his way to a manager's office with the purpose of killing him with a shotgun , a police sergeant said Wednesday during the man's arraignment . <p/>When Monday's violence had concluded , the receptionist - - Madeline Kafoury - - was shot dead and two managers , Paul Riva and Alan Steinberg , were wounded . <p/>Steinberg was shot in the hip and has spoken to police about the attack , while Riva had not yet regained consciousness and was on a ventilator . <p/>The man accused of <mark id="mark_id"> shooting </mark> his three former co - workers is Anthony LaCalamita III , a 38 - year - old Troy resident who was fired from Gordon Advisors on Thursday . <p/>A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during Wednesday's hearing . <p/>LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury , 63 , of Warren . <p/>He also is charged with two counts of intent to murder in the shootings of Riva , 47 , of Sterling Heights , and Steinberg , 48 , of Macomb County's Bruce Township - - as well as three counts of possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and one count of fleeing and eluding police . <p/>LaCalamita was asked by Judge Michael A . Martone if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder . <p/>He responded , "Yes , " to the series of questions posed by Martone . <p/>The judge ordered him held without bond pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>Kafoury's loved ones attended Wednesday's arraignment , and her daughter , Charlene - - holding a picture of Kafoury - - sobbed loudly during the proceedings . <p/>"She didn't do it . <p/>She didn't fire him , " Charlene Kafoury said . <p/>LaCalamita sat nearby and did not react to the comments from the victim's daughter . <p/>After the hearing , Charlene Kafoury and other loved ones gathered for a news conference . <p/>"She wasn't just a receptionist . . . . <p/>She was our mom and the grandmother of our children , " said Charlie Kafoury , Charlene's brother . <p/>"She was an essential point of our lives , " said a tearful Charlie Kafoury , who had difficulty getting out his words . <p/>A number of loved ones stood behind him and cried audibly . <p/>They engaged in a group hug after the news conference . <p/>Troy police Sgt . Barry Whiteside said LaCalamita first stopped at the reception area after 10 a . m . on Monday and talked to Kafoury , then entered Steinberg's office and asked him twice if he wanted to be shot . <p/>Steinberg told police he thought LaCalamita was holding a toy gun . <p/>"He didn't think it was real until he saw the shotgun was being racked , " Whiteside said . <p/>After shooting Steinberg , Whiteside said LaCalamita walked down the hall and into Riva's office . <p/>Kafoury , who was standing in the doorway of Riva's office , was struck in her midsection , Whiteside said . <p/>She fell to the floor and died from her wounds , he said . <p/>LaCalamita then fired one round at Riva , who was struck in the upper chest area . <p/>Riva tried to step over Kafoury and collapsed in the hall , Whiteside said . <p/>Police said LaCalamita targeted the two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one . <p/>"There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking , " said Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>The man , whom police did not identify , was not in the office suite at the time of the attack . <p/>Police said the shotgun was armed with buckshot that contained nine pellets in each shot . <p/>Some of the pellets hit the victims and some did not , police said . <p/>LaCalamita was fired from his position as a general accountant last Thursday because of poor performance , police said . <p/>According to receipts police recovered from his apartment , LaCalamita purchased the shotgun around 3 : 45 p . m . on Friday . <p/>LaCalamita was denied a handgun permit in March , said Scherlinck , who would not say why the permit was denied . <p/>LaCalamita was arrested Monday afternoon after leading police on a chase north along Interstate 75 in Genesee County in which speeds reached 120 mph . <p/>A 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells were found in the silver Ford Fusion LaCalamita was driving . <p/>Police said they found a long , cardboard box consistent to one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment during a search Monday evening .

Ann1 chose shoot.02
Ann2 chose shoot.01

text: A former employee recently let go from his job opened fire at an office Christmas party yesterday , killing one person .
marked_sentence: A former employee recently <mark id="mark_id"> let go </mark> from his job opened fire at an office Christmas party yesterday , killing one person .
marked_doc: A former employee recently <mark id="mark_id"> let go </mark> from his job opened fire at an office Christmas party yesterday , killing one person . <p/>Vancouver Police say the disgruntled man burst into the workplace during the party and opened fire . <p/>`` The suspect , a 61-year-old man , entered the business , which had at least a dozen people inside enjoying a Christmas party , '' police said in a statement . <p/>Police Const. Tim Fanning said the gunman came in around 4 p.m. local time . <p/>One man was shot and killed but the other partygoers managed to escape and no one else was injured . <p/>`` Police locked down the neighbourhood and negotiated with the suspect , who gave himself up to police just after 6 p.m. , '' Fanning said in the statement . <p/>The business at the location of the shooting is listed at TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a natural health product supplier . <p/>State police say a bomb exploded at an Oregon bank after it was evacuated and at least one bomb technician was injured . <p/>TheOregonian newspaper quotes a federal spokesman confirming that a bomb detonated at West Coast Bank in Woodburn . <p/>The spokesman for the Bureau of Alcohol , Tobacco , Firearms and Explosives also said at least one bomb technician had been injured . <p/>TheOregonianreports the bank had been evacuated before the bomb detonated .

text: Sacked worker shoots ex - colleagues
marked_sentence: Sacked worker <mark id="mark_id"> shoots </mark> ex - colleagues
marked_doc: http : / / www . theage . com . au / articles / 2007 / 04 / 10 / 1175971051701 . html <p/>Sacked worker <mark id="mark_id"> shoots </mark> ex - colleagues <p/>April 10 , 2007 - 7 : 07AM <p/>A man suspected of shooting three people , killing one , at a suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week was arrested after a high - speed chase a few hours after the attack this morning , authorities said . <p/>Police said they had located Anthony LaCalamita , 38 , on the Interstate 75 highway , north of the office building where the shootings took place . <p/>Sheriff's deputies and state police chased him for 48km , including through a construction zone , at speeds up to 193km / h before he finally pulled over after about 15 minutes , Genesee County Sheriff Robert J Pickell said . <p/>"He probably realised if he didn't , he was going to be shot , " Undersheriff James Gage said . <p/>LaCalamita said nothing after officers surrounded him , Pickell said , describing the suspect as "subdued . <p/>Very , very , very subdued" . <p/>Officers found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells in the vehicle , Pickell said . <p/>Witnesses said the shooter used a shotgun or a rifle , Troy police Lieutenant Gerry Scherlinck said . <p/>Some witnesses told police that when the shooter walked into the office on the building's second floor at about 10am today , he looked as if he was trying to hide something , Troy Police Chief Charles Craft said . <p/>Police could not say how many shots were fired . <p/>"I'm not positive all three of the people were targeted , but there appeared to be some purpose , " Craft said . <p/>The families of the two wounded men requested "total privacy" , and the hospital would not release any details about their conditions , Beaumont Hospital spokeswoman Ilene Wolfe said . <p/>She said the third victim died on the way to the hospital . <p/>LaCalamita was listed among the professional staff on the website of Gordon Advisers , a public accounting and business consulting firm in the building . <p/>Calls to Gordon Advisers were not answered this afternoon , and a recording said the offices were closed . <p/>The 15 , 800 - square - metre building houses a number of businesses , including law offices and the accounting firm . <p/>Police at first told workers to stay in their offices but a short time later evacuated the building , about 24km north of Detroit . <p/>Bill Adgate , who works at LPL Financial inside the building , said he had hunkered down inside the office for a couple of hours with furniture pushed up against the door . <p/>He said police told the group to stay put until officers allowed them to leave . <p/>"It's tough . <p/>I want to get out , " Adgate said by telephone .

Ann1 chose shoot.02

text: One man is dead after being shot by a gunman who marched into a company Christmas party Friday night .
marked_sentence: One man is dead after being <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> by a gunman who marched into a company Christmas party Friday night .
marked_doc: One man is dead after being <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> by a gunman who marched into a company Christmas party Friday night . <p/>Vancouver police have arrested a 61-year-old former employee after the shooting at Tallgrass Distributors Ltd. , an organic supplements and health product store in the Mount Pleasant neighbourhood near downtown Vancouver . <p/>`` A man who apparently had just been let go from his job there came in , shot and killed another man , '' Vancouver police Const . <p/>Tim Fanning told a news conference . <p/>`` There was at least a dozen other people on the scene . <p/>They managed to get out . <p/>`` Our negotiators got on the phone with him right away , and fortunately were able to talk him down from his very , very excited and upset state . text: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and shot and killed a man , according to police .
marked_sentence: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> and killed a man , according to police .
marked_doc: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> and killed a man , according to police . <p/>Police said they were called to Tallgrass Distributors Ltd. , in the central Mount Pleasant neighbourhood , where a man carrying a firearm had confronted the crowd . <p/>`` A man who apparently had just been let go from his job there came in , shot and killed another man , '' Vancouver police Const. Tim Fanning told a news conference . <p/>`` There was at least a dozen other people on the scene . <p/>They managed to get out . <p/>`` Our negotiators got on the phone with him right away , and fortunately were able to talk him down from his very , very excited and upset state . '' <p/>After two hours a 61-year-old man surrendered and was arrested . <p/>Fanning could n't say if anyone else was in the building at the time , but said no one else was injured . <p/>Nigel Hacker said he looked outside his nearby office at about 4:20 p.m. to see the street cordoned off . <p/>`` There was someone in the building and they were trying to get him out , '' Hacker said . <p/>`` I tried not to listen . '' <p/>But he caught the tone of the conversation . <p/>`` It was n't emotional from this end , '' he said . <p/>`` Everything seemed under control . <p/>They did a great job . '' <p/>Down the street at Paperny Films , John Christie said employees were planning to hold an office party upstairs when someone heard shots fired and the police came knocking at their door . <p/>`` We have been asked by the police to stay away from the windows and we 've been forced to go downstairs , '' Christie said . <p/>`` We 're having an office party anyway so we 're just staying out of the way , undercover . <p/>If we 're in a lockdown , at least we have beers and pizza . '' <p/>Christie said the police , who placed an undercover officer at Paperny 's front door , were n't pleased when some office workers fled through the back alley to get home . <p/>TallGrass claims it is the fastest-growing natural-health-product supplier to the Natural Health Industry in Canada . <p/>It was originally called Tallgrass Hemp Company , and supplied a variety of products based on the hemp plant , including Body Dope , a line of hair- and skin-care products made with hemp and other botanicals .

Gerry Scherlinck said . Gerry Scherlinck said . <p/>Some witnesses told police that when the shooter walked into the office on the building's second floor around 10 a . m . Monday , he looked as if he was trying to hide something , Troy Police Chief Charles Craft said . <p/>Police couldn't say how many shots were fired . <p/>'I'm not positive all three of the people were targeted , but there appeared to be some purpose , ' Craft said . <p/>The families of the two wounded men requested 'total privacy , ' and the hospital would not release any details about their conditions , Beaumont Hospital spokeswoman Ilene Wolfe said . <p/>She said the third victim died on the way to the hospital . <p/>LaCalamita was listed among the professional staff on the website of Gordon Advisors , a public accounting and business consulting firm in the building . <p/>Calls to Gordon Advisors were not answered Monday afternoon , and a recording said the offices were closed . " ( USA Today article ) <p/>Local evening news in Michigan originally reported that two of the three victims died . <p/>The subsequent car chase tied up traffic on the I - 75 corridor in Flint , Saginaw , and Bay City , Michigan for quite some time .

text: A former employee recently let go from his job opened fire at an office Christmas party Friday , killing one person , police said .
marked_sentence: A former employee recently <mark id="mark_id"> let go </mark> from his job opened fire at an office Christmas party Friday , killing one person , police said .
marked_doc: A former employee recently <mark id="mark_id"> let go </mark> from his job opened fire at an office Christmas party Friday , killing one person , police said . <p/>`` The suspect , a 61-year-old man , entered the business , which had at least a dozen people inside enjoying a Christmas party , `` police said in a statement . <p/>Police Const. Tim Fanning said the gunman entered the party around 4 p.m . <p/>One man was shot and killed but the other partygoers managed to escape and no one else was injured . <p/>`` Police 'locked down ' the neighborhood and negotiated with the suspect , who gave himself up to police just after 6 : 00 p.m. , '' Fanning said in the statement . <p/>The business at the location of the shooting is listed as TallGrass Distribution Ltd. , a natural health product supplier . <p/>Luke Pigeon , who lives in an apartment building next door , said he did n't hear a gunshot but heard a commotion outside his window . <p/>`` It was n't typical , crazy noise that sometimes happens . <p/>You got the feeling there was something definitely , definitely wrong , '' Pigeon told The Canadian Press . <p/>He looked out his window and saw someone fleeing the building next door . <p/>`` All of a sudden in my front yard there were five totally decked out , geared up riot squad officers with guns out of the holster , aiming at the second floor of the building right beside us , '' Pigeon said . <p/>He spent the next two hours in his apartment , with armed officers about 10 feet from his front window as police tried to negotiate with the suspect . <p/>Finally , he heard activity as the gunman gave himself up . <p/>`` They cuffed him on the ground and they took him into a cruiser , '' he said . <p/>`` He was giving them a bit of grief , he was saying that his cuffs hurt . '' <p/>Police said the victim 's name would not be released until next of kin had been notified . <p/>They said the name of the suspect would be released after he is formally charged .

text: Fired Accountant Goes on Shooting Spree
marked_sentence: Fired Accountant <mark id="mark_id"> Goes </mark> on Shooting Spree
marked_doc: http : / / www . accountingweb . com / topic / watchdog / fired - accountant - goes - shooting - spree <p/>Fired Accountant <mark id="mark_id"> Goes </mark> on Shooting Spree <p/>on Apr 12 2007 <p/>A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job , then returned to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses , wounding both and killing a receptionist , the Associated Press reported . <p/>Troy , Mich . police said Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , targeted two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one . <p/>"There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking , " said Troy police Lt . Gerry Scherlinck . <p/>The man , whom police did not identify , was not in the office at the time of the attack . <p/>LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday , Scherlinck said . <p/>He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun , as well as empty shell boxes , in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening . <p/>When LaCalamita was arrested , police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle . <p/>Scherlinck said LaCalamita had been denied a handgun permit in March but it wasn't clear why . <p/>Anthony LaCalamita III , 38 , had been arrested following a high - speed chase shortly after the Monday morning shootings at Gordon Advisors in suburban Detroit . <p/>During LaCalamita's arraignment , authorities described what witnesses saw inside the accounting firm's offices that morning . <p/>LaCalamita walked in around 10 a . m . , stopped briefly at the reception desk , then entered Alan Steinberg's office with the shotgun , Troy police Sgt . Barry Whiteside testified . <p/>Steinberg , a partner in the firm , later told police LaCalamita loaded a shell into the shotgun's chamber and fired at him , hitting him in the hip area . <p/>He then walked toward the office of Paul Riva , another partner . <p/>Receptionist Madeline Kafoury was standing in the doorway of Riva's office , and the gunman fatally shot her in the midsection , Whiteside said . <p/>LaCalamita shot Riva in the upper chest , then left the building , Whiteside said . <p/>He was gone when officers swarmed the office building and began evacuating other workers , then was arrested a few hours later after a chase on a nearby interstate . <p/>Riva had yet to regain consciousness Wednesday and was on a ventilator , police said . <p/>LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury , 63 , and intent to murder in the shootings of Riva , 47 , and Steinberg , 48 . <p/>He also is charged with possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and fleeing and eluding police . <p/>A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during the hearing . <p/>Asked by the judge if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder , he responded "Yes . " <p/>The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19 . <p/>The judge said he would appoint a lawyer for LaCalamita . <p/>He did not have a representative in court Wednesday . <p/>LaCalamita is married , but his wife , Michele , released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks . <p/>According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press , the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes . <p/>Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four . <p/>Riva and Steinberg were being treated at Beaumont Hospital , where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released .

text: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and allegedly shot and killed a man .
marked_sentence: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and allegedly <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> and killed a man .
marked_doc: A former employee walked into a staff Christmas party at an east Vancouver health products business Friday and allegedly <mark id="mark_id"> shot </mark> and killed a man . <p/>Police said they were called to Tallgrass Distributors Ltd. , at 40 East Fifth Avenue. , where a 61-year-old man carrying a firearm had confronted the crowd . <p/>Const. Tim Fanning said the man , who had recently lost his job at Tallgrass , walked into the party and pointed the gun at the victim . <p/>He then let about a dozen employees leave before holing up inside the office building with the victim . <p/>Hostage negotiators were called in to get the man out of the building . <p/>He finally surrendered at 6 p.m. and was arrested . <p/>Fanning could n't say if anyone else was in the building at the time , but said no one else was injured . <p/>Police used a neighbouring office as a base for the negotiations . <p/>Nigel Hacker , who runs Intarsia Design out of a heritage home at 2016 Ontario , said he was in his office waiting for people to attend a meeting at about 4 : 20 p.m . <p/>He looked outside to see the street cordoned off . <p/>Police set up shop at the office and began trying to coax the gunman out of the building around the corner at 40 East 5th Avenue . <p/>`` There was someone in the building and they were trying to get him out , '' Hacker said . <p/>`` I tried not to listen . '' <p/>But he caught the tone of the conversation . <p/>`` It was n't emotional from this end , '' he said . <p/>`` Everything seemed under control. They did a great job . '' <p/>Just before 7 p.m. Friday , the lights were still blazing at the two-storey 1950s-style office building , which was decorated with a Christmas tree and Santas made of cotton wool . <p/>Early on , about a dozen police officers milled about outside securing the building , while others blocked nearby intersections and directed traffic away from Ontario Street . <p/>A Coast Mountain bus was called in to collect witnesses , TransLink spokesman Drew Snider said . <p/>Offices around the neighbourhood were shut down , with staff either told to stay indoors or escorted outside to their cars or other transport . <p/>Lorin Pearce , an executive assistant at Focus Audio Visual Services on West Fifth , said she saw what appeared to be a police officer with a gun at the corner of Fifth and Ontario . <p/>She did n't know the focus of the police attention , but said the corner is home to several businesses . <p/>When some employees tried to leave , they were told by police to stay inside the office until further notice , she said around 5 : 30 p.m . <p/>`` A couple of us tried to exit and they said , 'Please go back inside , ' '' <p/>Pearce said , adding she was not afraid for her own safety . <p/>Staff at Fiji Island Auto , across the street from Tallgrass , were told to close shop at 5:30 p.m. and were escorted by police off the premises . <p/>Down the street , John Christie , head of house production for Paperny Films at Fifth and Quebec , said employees were planning to hold an office party upstairs when someone heard shots fired and the police came knocking at their door . <p/>`` We have been asked by the police to stay away from the windows and we 've been forced to go downstairs , '' Christie said . <p/>`` We 're having an office party anyway so we 're just staying out of the way , undercover . <p/>If we 're in a lockdown , at least we have beers and pizza . '' <p/>Christie said the police , who placed an undercover officer at Paperny 's front door , were n't pleased when some office workers fled through the back alley to get home . <p/>An employee of another nearby business , Relaxus Massage Products , said staff were escorted to their cars by police so they could go home . <p/>TallGrass claims it is the fastest-growing natural-health-product supplier to the Natural Health Industry in Canada . <p/>It was originally called Tallgrass Hemp Company , and supplied a variety of products based on the hemp plant , including Body Dope , a line of hair- and skin-care products made with hemp and other botanicals . <p/>Products also include shampoo , conditioner , therapeutic lotion and soap

marked_doc: http : / / theforumnewsgroup . com / 2013 / 09 / 19 / grandmother - killed - by - drunk - driver - in - hit - and - run - accident - in - richmond - hill - queens - da - says / <p/>GRANDMOTHER KILLED BY DRUNK DRIVER IN HIT - AND - RUN ACCIDENT IN RICHMOND HILL , QUEENS DA SAYSSEPTEMBER 19 , 2013 <p/>A 59 - year - old grandmother on her way to a religious service in Richmond Hill last Friday was hit and killed by an allegedly drunk driver who fled the scene of the accident that left her family and friends devastated , Queens District Attorney Richard Brown said . <p/>Raj Chohan , who lived in South Ozone Park , was walking towards a Sikh temple for a Friday evening service when Vishwanand Subryan , 23 , of Schenectady , N . Y . , allegedly <mark id="mark_id"> mowed </mark> into the older woman with his gray 2013 Toyota Camry around 7 p . m . , police said . <p/>Emergency workers rushed to her side and brought her to Jamaica Hospital Medical Center , where Chohan – an immigrant from India who leaves behind a husband , son and two grandchildren – died later that night , police said . <p/>Subryan has been charged with vehicular manslaughter , criminally negligent homicide , driving while under the influence of alcohol , and leaving the scene of an accident without reporting it , the DA said . <p/>“ Drinking and driving is a deadly combination – one that has the potential of turning a vehicle into a lethal weapon , ” Brown said in a prepared statement . <p/>“ In this case , the defendant is accused of getting behind the wheel while under the influence of alcohol , being unable to maintain proper control of his vehicle , and striking a pedestrian before speeding away without checking to see if she needed medical assistance . ” <p/>Arraigned on Sept . 15 , Subryan was ordered held on $200 , 000 bail and is expected to return to Queens Supreme Court in Kew Gardens on Oct . 2 . <p/>According to the criminal charges , two police officers from the 102nd Precinct were stationed on 117th Street at approximately 7 p . m . on Friday night , when they heard a loud bang behind them and one of the officers saw fluorescent garments fly in the air . <p/>When the officers turned around , they allegedly saw Subryan speed past them . <p/>He then allegedly ran a stop sign and red light when police began to pursue him , the DA said . <p/>When cops stopped the car , police allegedly observed Subryan to have bloodshot watery eyes and slurred speech and smelled of alcohol , according to Brown . <p/>Additionally , he was allegedly swaying and unsteady on his feet when he got out of his car – which police wrote had a dented hood , a cracked bumper and front headlight , and scuff marks on the hood , the NYPD said . <p/>The driver was taken to the 112th Precinct , where police documented that he allegedly had a blood alcohol content of . 09 percent – above New York ’ s legal limit of . 08 percent . <p/>A civilian witness at the scene also told police that they saw a car speed by and then saw Chohan , who was wearing bright yellow clothing and went into cardiac arrest , laying in the street , the DA said . <p/>Video surveillance from the area showed the vehicle striking Chohan , causing her to become airborne , according to Brown . <p/>The tragic event was one of three accidents involving pedestrians in the city last weekend . <p/>A female pedestrian was struck and killed by a motorist when she was crossing Queens Plaza North near 27th Street a little before 10 p . m . on Friday , according to police . <p/>The unidentified woman was pronounced dead at Mount Sinai Hospital . <p/>Maria Dulce - Valencia , 27 , was also killed in a hit - and - run accident , police said . <p/>She was hit around 5 a . m . Sunday morning at Bruckner Boulevard and Evergreen Avenue in the Bronx ’ s Soundview neighborhood .

Chohan was walking alongside parked cars on 117th Street and 97th Avenue at about 7 p . m . when she was struck by a gray 2013 Toyota Camry , which then <mark id="mark_id"> sped off </mark> , according to cops . <p/>“ The husband and wife came to visit , ” said South Richmond Hill resident Suri Charanjit . <p/>“ He was with her when it happened . ” <p/>Charanjit said he and his family came out of their home on 117th Street and saw a crowd of people gathered and EMS performing CPR on Chohan . <p/>Emergency responders were called in and took Chohan to Jamaica Hospital , where she was later pronounced dead , the NYPD said . <p/>Residents along 117th Street said a police cruiser happened to be pulled over on the side of the road near where the crash occurred , and immediately chased the vehicle . <p/>Police said the officers caught up with 23 - year - old Vishwanand Subryan of Schenectady a few blocks away - at 115th Street and 101st Avenue - where he was taken into custody without incident . <p/>Subryan was charged with vehicular manslaughter , criminally negligent homicide , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death and DWI , the NYPD said . <p/>Chohan , who is a mother to a married son and daughter , had been in her former neighborhood to visit Piara Singh , according to Charanjit who translated for Singh . <p/>She had moved about a mile and a half away five or six years ago , her friend said . <p/>As part of a Sikh tradition , she had been visiting to greet Singh ’ s daughter - in - law , who recently arrived from India , and present her with gifts , he explained . <p/>Chohan had called Singh ’ s house to let the family know she was outside and asked that someone open the door . <p/>“ When [ Singh ’ s ] son came out , he saw her on the floor , ” Charanjit said . <p/>Both Charanjit and Singh complained cars speeding along 117th Street . <p/>“ The cars come straight from 103rd Avenue . <p/>They have no stop sign , no bump , nothing but green until 95th Avenue , ” Charanjit said . <p/>“ This is just a side street . <p/>We want to have a stop sign . ”

text: The man police say is behind a fatal hit and run outside a Sam 's Club store in Bloomington , now faces a murder charge .
marked_sentence: The man police say is behind a fatal <mark id="mark_id"> hit and run </mark> outside a Sam 's Club store in Bloomington , now faces a murder charge .
marked_doc: Man charged in fatal Bloomington hit and run <p/>The man police say is behind a fatal <mark id="mark_id"> hit and run </mark> outside a Sam 's Club store in Bloomington , now faces a murder charge . <p/>The Hennepin County attorney 's office handed down charges to Anthony Phillip Lasalle Friday , which include one count of third-degree murder and three counts of criminal vehicular homicide . <p/>Police said 66-year-old LuAnn Marie Johnson , of Burnsville , was with her husband when she was struck in the crosswalk outside the store , located at 200 West American Boulevard , around 7 p.m. Wednesday . <p/>Paramedics rushed Johnson to Hennepin County Medical Center where she died . <p/>`` Kind , gentle , Christian , loved the Lord , and she 's better off where she is now , '' said Lois Scholz , a friend of LuAnn 's . <p/>Scholz lives across the hall from LuAnn and her husband Leroy . <p/>`` Leroy was blessed and he 's comfortable with this , '' Scholz said . <p/>`` I talked with him and he 's very at peace with the idea that she 's with the Lord . '' <p/>After a struggle , officers were able to apprehend the Bloomington man a few blocks away from the scene , by using a taser . <p/>During his flee , Lasalle struck two other vehicles , but no one was injured , according to authorities . <p/>According to the criminal complaint , Lasalle was transported to Fairview Southdale Hospital to be treated for his injures he sustained during his apprehension . <p/>He also had blood drawn , which was tested , and resulted in showing his blood-alcohol level was .41 . <p/>Lasalle told police he had drank a half-liter of vodka before driving to Sam 's Club . <p/>He also admitted that he knew he had hit someone and was required to stop . <p/>However , he told officials that because he was drunk , it affected his decision to leave the scene . <p/>State records show Lasalle has three prior DUI convictions , spanning from 1990 to 1991 . <p/>He also has two motor vehicle theft convictions . <p/>Lasalle is in custody . <p/>If convicted , he faces up to 55 years in prison , a $ 60,000 fine , or both .
user_input:
Ann1 chose hit.01
Ann2 chose crash.01

text: When a 59 - year - old woman stepped out of her car at 97th Avenue and 117th Street , she was struck by a car .

marked_doc: http : / / www . nyaccidentcase . com / blog / 2013 / 09 / hit - and - run - crash - leaves - queens - mother - of - 2 - dead . shtml <p/>Hit - and - run crash leaves Queens mother of 2 dead <p/>On behalf of Newman , Anzalone & Newman , LLP . posted in Hit and Run Accidents on Friday , September 20 , 2013 . <p/>In New York , there are laws about what to do if you have been involved in an accident . <p/>One extremely important law is that both drivers must remain at the scene of the crash if someone was injured or killed . <p/>This law helps make sure that no one is left behind to try to get help on their own . <p/>Unfortunately , some people are too afraid of the other potential consequences of a serious crash that they choose to flee the scene , leaving victims to fend for themselves . <p/>This type of negligence can lead to a delay in treatment , which could result in death . <p/>Just last week , a serious hit - and - run accident took place in Queens . <p/>When a 59 - year - old woman <mark id="mark_id"> stepped out </mark> of her car at 97th Avenue and 117th Street , she was struck by a car . <p/>Instead of stopping to help her , however , the driver fled the scene . <p/>Sadly , the mother of two died from injuries she sustained in the crash . <p/>Thankfully , a police officer was nearby and saw the collision . <p/>He chased down the driver and eventually arrested him . <p/>The driver was charged with drunk driving , leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death , and vehicular manslaughter . <p/>For victims injured in a hit - and - run accident and the family members of those who were killed by hit - and - run drivers , the aftermath of such accidents can be very difficult to deal with . <p/>On top of trying to recover from injuries or grieving the loss of a loved one , many people wonder how they will be able to obtain compensation for costs incurred due to the accident . <p/>Even if you don't know who hit you , there are ways to obtain compensation for the damages inflicted in a hit - and - run crash . <p/>Whether you work with an attorney to find the driver or pursue compensation through your personal injury protection coverage , there are ways to make sure you get the financial help you need after an accident .

text: Even as Oscar organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film awards , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was casting a long shadow over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual .
marked_sentence: Even as Oscar organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film awards , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was <mark id="mark_id"> casting a long shadow </mark> over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual .
marked_doc: Even as Oscar organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film awards , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was <mark id="mark_id"> casting a long shadow </mark> over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual . <p/>The Academy Awards ' February 22 date puts it directly in the path of a potential walkout by Screen Actors Guild members who vote next month on whether to give union leaders permission to call a strike in stalemated contract talks with major studios . <p/>Movie making by the big studios has wound down since late June in anticipation of labor strife , compounding a general slowdown from the U.S. recession . <p/>The tension has only been heightened by fatigue from a tumultuous 14-week Hollywood writers strike that ended in February and cost the Los Angeles area economy around $ 3 billion as production stopped on most prime-time TV shows . <p/>`` A strike , if one occurred , would be nothing short of horrible , '' said Ron Howard , the former actor and Oscar-winning director of `` A Beautiful Mind '' whose latest film , `` Frost/Nixon , '' is considered a strong Oscar contender . <p/>`` The timing could n't be worse , '' he said on Thursday . <p/>Actor Leonardo DiCaprio , who on Thursday earned a Golden Globe nomination for his work in `` Revolutionary Road , '' said strike concerns are hitting `` everyone . '' <p/>`` It 's really important that we come up with a solution , '' he said . <p/>`` These are unheard-of times , and no one can predict what is going to happen '' with the U.S. economy . <p/>SAG 'S DARK CLOUD <p/>The Oscars , given out by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences , are annually Hollywood 's glitziest night . <p/>Putting the show in jeopardy , however , was this week 's announcement by SAG that strike authorization ballots will be mailed to its 120,000 members on January 2 and tallied on January 23 , a full month before the Oscars . <p/>That sequence of events raises the prospect of A-list stars boycotting the honors to avoid crossing their own union 's picket lines -- or even carrying picket signs themselves . <p/>The same dynamic came into play last January when a work stoppage by 10,500 Writers Guild of America members threw the awards season into disarray and caused the star-filled Golden Globe Awards to be replaced by a news conference . <p/>Only 5.8 million TV viewers tuned-in , far below the Globes ' typical 20 million audience . <p/>Broadcaster NBC lost an estimated $ 10 million to $ 15 million in advertising revenue . <p/>The writers strike was settled a month later , sparing the Academy Awards and its network , ABC , a similar fate . <p/>But this time around , the Oscars are on the firing line and Australian actor Jackman , star of the `` X-Men '' movies as well as Broadway stage shows , may himself have to pull out . <p/>`` At this point , we are moving forward with all of our plans to do our show , and of course we are monitoring what is going on , '' said Academy spokeswoman Leslie Unger . <p/>SAG leaders say they need a credible strike threat to wrest a better contract deal from the studios than the `` final '' offer management presented before talks collapsed on June 30 . <p/>They stress , however , that a `` yes '' vote does not automatically put a strike into effect , and it remains uncertain whether SAG can text: Even as Oscar organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film awards , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was casting a long shadow over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual .
marked_sentence: Even as Oscar organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film <mark id="mark_id"> awards </mark> , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was casting a long shadow over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual .
marked_doc: Even as Oscar organizers on Friday unveiled Hugh Jackman as the host of their gala film <mark id="mark_id"> awards </mark> , the prospect of a U.S. actors strike was casting a long shadow over whether Hollywood 's big show would go on as usual . <p/>The Academy Awards ' February 22 date puts it directly in the path of a potential walkout by Screen Actors Guild members who vote next month on whether to give union leaders permission to call a strike in stalemated contract talks with major studios . <p/>Movie making by the big studios has wound down since late June in anticipation of labor strife , compounding a general slowdown from the U.S. recession . <p/>The tension has only been heightened by fatigue from a tumultuous 14-week Hollywood writers strike that ended in February and cost the Los Angeles area economy around $ 3 billion as production stopped on most prime-time TV shows . <p/>`` A strike , if one occurred , would be nothing short of horrible , '' said Ron Howard , the former actor and Oscar-winning director of `` A Beautiful Mind '' whose latest film , `` Frost/Nixon , '' is considered a strong Oscar contender . <p/>`` The timing could n't be worse , '' he said on Thursday . <p/>Actor Leonardo DiCaprio , who on Thursday earned a Golden Globe nomination for his work in `` Revolutionary Road , '' said strike concerns are hitting `` everyone . '' <p/>`` It 's really important that we come up with a solution , '' he said . <p/>`` These are unheard-of times , and no one can predict what is going to happen '' with the U.S. economy . <p/>SAG 'S DARK CLOUD <p/>The Oscars , given out by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences , are annually Hollywood 's glitziest night . <p/>Putting the show in jeopardy , however , was this week 's announcement by SAG that strike authorization ballots will be mailed to its 120,000 members on January 2 and tallied on January 23 , a full month before the Oscars . <p/>That sequence of events raises the prospect of A-list stars boycotting the honors to avoid crossing their own union 's picket lines -- or even carrying picket signs themselves . <p/>The same dynamic came into play last January when a work stoppage by 10,500 Writers Guild of America members threw the awards season into disarray and caused the star-filled Golden Globe Awards to be replaced by a news conference . <p/>Only 5.8 million TV viewers tuned-in , far below the Globes ' typical 20 million audience . <p/>Broadcaster NBC lost an estimated $ 10 million to $ 15 million in advertising revenue . <p/>The writers strike was settled a month later , sparing the Academy Awards and its network , ABC , a similar fate . <p/>But this time around , the Oscars are on the firing line and Australian actor Jackman , star of the `` X-Men '' movies as well as Broadway stage shows , may himself have to pull out . <p/>`` At this point , we are moving forward with all of our plans to do our show , and of course we are monitoring what is going on , '' said Academy spokeswoman Leslie Unger . <p/>SAG leaders say they need a credible strike threat to wrest a better contract deal from the studios than the `` final '' offer management presented before talks collapsed on June 30 . <p/>They stress , however , that a `` yes '' vote does not automatically put a strike into effect , and it remains uncertain whether SAG can muster the support it needs -- 75 percent of those voting -- to pass its authorization . <p/>Talks collapsed over issues that included how much actors would get paid for work on the Internet , and the financial impact of a possible strike on Hollywood remains unclear . <p/>Most films slated for release in 2009 already have been shot , meaning the 2010 slate would see the brunt of a strike . <p/>Some TV prime-time dramas and sitcoms will have completed production before SAG a work stoppage , though a walkout could hinder development of new series for Fall 2009 .

text: Hugh Jackman , the Australian actor known to film audiences for playing a furry comic-book hero in the X-Men movies , will be host of the 81st incarnation of the Oscars , the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced on Friday .
marked_sentence: Hugh Jackman , the Australian actor <mark id="mark_id"> known </mark> to film audiences for playing a furry comic-book hero in the X-Men movies , will be host of the 81st incarnation of the Oscars , the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced on Friday .
marked_doc: The producers of the Academy Awards are counting on a mutant wolverine who is People magazine 's reigning Sexiest Man Alive to inject some desperately needed razzle-dazzle into their annual telecast . <p/>Hugh Jackman , the Australian actor <mark id="mark_id"> known </mark> to film audiences for playing a furry comic-book hero in the X-Men movies , will be host of the 81st incarnation of the Oscars , the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced on Friday . <p/>ABC will broadcast the awards show on Feb. 22 . <p/>Its producers said they hoped to achieve multiple goals with the casting of Mr. Jackman . <p/>First , there is a desire to put more movie in the annual movie business extravaganza . <p/>Jon Stewart and Ellen DeGeneres , recent hosts , are both primarily known as television stars . <p/>Laurence Mark , a co-producer of the Oscars telecast , with Bill Condon , said there was also a desire to steer clear of stand-up comedians . <p/>`` We are trying to get away from this late-night talk show rut , '' Mr. Mark said in a telephone interview . <p/>`` It seemed to us that we needed to turn a corner and get somebody who is , imagine that , a movie star . '' <p/>Mr. Jackman 's selection is also an attempt to play to the audience at home , which has been shrinking in recent years . <p/>Viewers of the ceremony are overwhelmingly female - the Oscars are known in the advertising world as the Super Bowl for women - and producers clearly expect Mr. Jackman to turn out that demographic in droves . <p/>`` It certainly did not escape us that Hugh looks terrific in a tuxedo , '' Mr. Mark said . <p/>With any luck , a host plucked from within the movie industry 's own ranks - and less emphasis on stand-up comedy , which has often been at the expense of people sitting in the audience - will also play well inside the Kodak Theater . <p/>In recent years the crowd of movie insiders has seemed to respond to hosts with notable coldness . <p/>A representative for Mr. Jackman said he was walking a red carpet in Berlin on behalf of his current film , the epic `` Australia , '' and was unavailable for an interview . <p/>Deadlinehollywooddaily.com first reported his selection on the Web . <p/>Mr. Jackman , 40 , has never been nominated for an Oscar but has artistic credibility , an important credential for the M.C. of the film awards show . <p/>He has won positive reviews for turns in films like `` The Prestige '' and `` Kate and Leopold . '' <p/>He won a Tony Award in 2004 for his role in the musical `` The Boy from Oz . '' <p/>He also has experience as an awards show M.C. , winning an Emmy in 2005 for his appearance as host of the Tonys . <p/>He presided over that ceremony three times . <p/>The Oscars are a very different phenomenon from the Tonys . <p/>The film honors are an awkward hybrid - a telecast about the movies set in a theater - that require their host to oscillate between jocular chitchat and solemn introductions , while sprinkling in just the right amount of self-deprecation . <p/>Serving as host of the three-hour live show requires physical stamina and an ability to hold up under the emotional pressure of knowing that the television audience , while diminished in the United States , numbers several hundred million worldwide . <p/>This year Mr. Jackman will have the added pressure of serving as the ringmaster of a lavish self-congratulation-a-thon at a time of global economic crisis . <p/>Preparing for the job may prove difficult , since producers will most likely need to draw up contingency plans in the event of a Screen Actors Guild strike . <p/>The union , at loggerheads with studios over contract issues big and small , said on Wednesday that it would ask its members to authorize a strike . <p/>The union , which will announce the results of the vote in late January , sees its power to wreak havoc with the Oscars as prime leverage . <p/>The telecast has come under harsh criticism in recent years as a lumbering snore that takes itself too seriously and lacks spontaneity . <p/>Star wattage has dimmed , with many members of the A list refusing to attend unless they are nominated or have a coming film to promote . <p/>A trend toward honoring small , independent movies that most people have not seen has dented viewership . <p/>Ratings for last year 's Oscars plunged to a record low , with about 32 million people tuning in , compared with 55.3 million a decade ago . <p/>Mr. Condon and Mr. Mark , who recently served as the creative team behind the movie `` Dreamgirls , '' are trying to energize the telecast partly by making the ceremony more of a party that celebrates movies in general , not just the elite few selected by Academy voters . <p/>`` We are still at the preliminary conversation stage about what Hugh wants to do , but his theatrical talent certainly does give us reason to do at least one musical number , '' Mr. Mark said .

text: As word got out Friday that Hugh Jackman will be this year 's Oscar host , a clip from the 2004 Tony telecast of his performance from `` The Boy From Oz '' made the rounds .
marked_sentence: As word got out Friday that Hugh Jackman will be this year 's Oscar host , a clip from the 2004 Tony telecast of his performance from `` The Boy From Oz '' <mark id="mark_id"> made the rounds </mark> .
marked_doc: If only he 'll wear those gold lame pants . <p/>As word got out Friday that Hugh Jackman will be this year 's Oscar host , a clip from the 2004 Tony telecast of his performance from `` The Boy From Oz '' <mark id="mark_id"> made the rounds </mark> . <p/>If you happened to miss the 2004 Tonys , Jackman , playing the flamboyant Australian songwriter Peter Allen , sang , danced and writhed his way across the stage in a leopard skin top and skin-tight gold lame pants . <p/>Will the Oscar gift baskets include smelling salts ? <p/>Jackman , who has hosted the Tonys several times and won an Emmy for doing so in 2005 , certainly knows how to hold a stage -- he won a Tony for `` The Boy From Oz '' -- and by choosing him , first-time Oscar producers Laurence Mark and Bill Condon are betting that Broadway can do what comedy could not . <p/>Previous hosts -- Jon Stewart , Ellen DeGeneres , Chris Rock -- all followed the traditional stand-up model and the ratings have steadily soured . <p/>Obviously a change is required , and though I would lean toward thinking `` television '' rather than `` Broadway '' ( why , I even wrote a piece about it , for this coming Sunday 's Calendar , before the host choice was announced ) , Jackman is , of course , another way to go . <p/>Clearly Mark and Condon are less concerned with solving the ratings crisis as they are with creating a new vibe for the show . <p/>Jackman may have more talent in his little finger than most of us do in our entire bodies , but he does n't have the fan base of DeGeneres or Rock . <p/>If you are among the thousands who loved his hosting of the Tonys , you 're probably not only watching the Oscars anyway , you 're hosting your own annual Oscar party . <p/>Yes , Jackman was just named People 's Sexiest Man Alive , and yes , he is Wolverine of `` X-Men '' but do we want Wolverine hosting the Oscars ? <p/>Probably not . <p/>Otherwise , Jackman 's movie career has been less than memorable , capped by this year 's box office dud `` Australia . '' <p/>And as last season 's mercifully short-lived `` Viva Laughlin '' proved , one talented person does not a television show make . <p/>Or at least not a good television show . <p/>But Mark and Condon are the team that brought us `` Dreamgirls , '' which actually makes Jackman an obvious choice . <p/>There 's nothing wrong with a big Broadway-esque opener similar to Billy Crystal 's famous musical clips , but with more hip action . <p/>Beyond that , however , it gets a little worrisome . <p/>The Oscars have a prickly relationship with singin ' and dancin ' and as anyone who saw Rosie O'Donnell 's recent disaster knows , nothing fails bigger than a failed variety show . <p/>What Jackman does have in his favor is an unapologetic , unabashed love for , and understanding of , theater . <p/>He is n't snarky and he is n't an outsider . <p/>He is a from-the-bottom-of-his-heart performer who seems utterly happy and at ease in front of an audience . <p/>No doubt those in the Kodak will enjoy an energetic and dazzling evening . <p/>How it will play on television remains to be seen . <p/>But maybe it 's time we stopped caring about that so much .

<p/>Jackman , who has hosted the Tonys several times and won an Emmy for doing so in 2005 , certainly knows how to hold a stage -- he won a Tony for `` The Boy From Oz '' -- and by choosing him , first-time Oscar producers Laurence Mark and Bill Condon are betting that Broadway can do what comedy could not . <p/>Previous hosts -- Jon Stewart , Ellen DeGeneres , Chris Rock -- all followed the traditional stand-up model and the ratings have steadily soured . <p/>Obviously a change is required , and though I would lean toward thinking `` television '' rather than `` Broadway '' ( why , I even wrote a piece about it , for this coming Sunday 's Calendar , before the host choice was announced ) , Jackman is , of course , another way to go . <p/>Clearly Mark and Condon are less concerned with solving the ratings crisis as they are with creating a new vibe for the show . <p/>Jackman may have more talent in his little finger than most of us do in our entire bodies , but he does n't have the fan base of DeGeneres or Rock . <p/>If you are among the thousands who loved his hosting of the Tonys , you 're probably not only watching the Oscars anyway , you 're hosting your own annual Oscar party . <p/>Yes , Jackman was just named People 's Sexiest Man Alive , and yes , he is Wolverine of `` X-Men '' but do we want Wolverine hosting the Oscars ? <p/>Probably not . <p/>Otherwise , Jackman 's movie career has been less than memorable , capped by this year 's box office dud `` Australia . '' <p/>And as last season 's mercifully short-lived `` Viva Laughlin '' proved , one talented person does not a television show make . <p/>Or at least not a good television show . <p/>But Mark and Condon are the team that brought us `` Dreamgirls , '' which actually makes Jackman an obvious choice . <p/>There 's nothing wrong with a big Broadway-esque opener similar to Billy Crystal 's famous musical clips , but with more hip action . <p/>Beyond that , however , it gets a little worrisome . <p/>The Oscars have a prickly relationship with singin ' and dancin ' and as anyone who saw Rosie O'Donnell 's recent disaster knows , nothing fails bigger than a failed variety show . <p/>What Jackman does have in his favor is an unapologetic , unabashed love for , and understanding of , theater . <p/>He is n't snarky and he is n't an outsider . <p/>He is a from-the-bottom-of-his-heart performer who seems utterly happy and at ease in front of an audience . <p/>No doubt those in the Kodak will enjoy an energetic and dazzling evening . <p/>How it will play on television remains to be seen . <p/>But maybe it 's time we stopped caring about that so much .
user_input:
Ann1 chose perform.01
Ann2 chose perform.02

text: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane .
marked_sentence: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will <mark id="mark_id"> make </mark> her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane .
marked_doc: http : / / www . reuters . com / article / 2013 / 08 / 02 / us - oscars - degeneres - idUSBRE9710UQ20130802 <p/>Comedian Ellen DeGeneres picked to host 2014 Oscars <p/>Fri Aug 2 , 2013 6 : 50pm EDT <p/>Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will <mark id="mark_id"> make </mark> her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year , organizers said on Friday , in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane . <p/>DeGeneres , the star of her own daytime talk show "Ellen , " first hosted the Oscars in 2007 , becoming only the second woman to fill that exalted role alone , after Whoopi Goldberg . <p/>"I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time , " DeGeneres said in a statement . <p/>"You know what they say - the third time's the charm . " <p/>"I'd like to thank @TheAcademy , my wife Portia and , oh dear , there goes the orchestra , " the comedian added on Twitter . <p/>DeGeneres , 55 , earned an Emmy nomination for her performance in 2007 in which she departed from traditional Oscar hosting decorum and ventured into the audience for spot gags , at one point handing director Martin Scorsese a script of her own . <p/>"Choosing DeGeneres , known for her kindler , gentler humor , signals that the Academy's next awards show will have a decidedly different tone than the 85th Academy Awards , " trade magazine The Hollywood Reporter wrote . <p/>DeGeneres also earned praise for her performance as the host of TV's Emmy awards in 2001 , which was twice delayed because of the September 11 attacks , memorably lightening the somber mood by asking , "What would bug the Taliban more than seeing a gay woman in a suit surrounded by Jews ? " <p/>The announcement of DeGeneres as host also comes on the heels of Hollywood marketing executive Cheryl Boone Isaacs being elected as the first African American president of the 6 , 000 - member Academy , which has made an effort to diversify its ranks after coming under fire for being too male , old and white . <p/>Trade publication Variety saw the choice of DeGeneres as a continuation of the Academy's "Year of the Woman , " writing that the Oscars "will put women in the driver's seat . "

marked_doc: http : / / www . theguardian . com / film / 2013 / aug / 02 / ellen - degeneres - host - oscars - 2014 <p/>Ellen DeGeneres to host Oscars in 2014 <p/>This will be second time hosting for the daytime talkshow star who will follow on from Seth MacFarlane's savaged 2013 <mark id="mark_id"> stint </mark> <p/>The comedian Ellen DeGeneres announced on Friday that she is to return as host of the Academy Awards , the second time she has been tasked with saving the Oscars a year after a poorly received performer . <p/>For the 2014 show , she follows a heavily criticised performance this year by the Family Guy creator Seth MacFarlane . <p/>In 2007 , she put the Oscars back on an even keel after poor reviews for the satirist Jon Stewart in 2006 . <p/>"I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time . <p/>You know what they say – the third time's the charm , " DeGeneres said in a statement . <p/>She is a safe bet for the Academy , following an outraged reaction to the misogynistic jokes that peppered MacFarlane's script . <p/>While MacFarlane's performance generated high ratings for the broadcast – 40 . 3 million people watched , 2% higher than the year before – he said he would not host the Oscars again because of the negative response . <p/>DeGeneres however , has a history of well - received hosting gigs . <p/>She was nominated for a Primetime Emmy for her performance as Oscars host in 2007 . <p/>She also garnered positive responses as a two - time Emmy Awards host , carrying the ceremony shortly after 9 / 11 and then after Hurricane Katrina . <p/>Her previous Oscar gig , in which Martin Scorsese's The Departed took home the top prize , was watched by 39 . 9 million people . <p/>DeGeneres made the announcement on Twitter on Friday and said : "It's official : I'm hosting the #Oscars ! <p/>I'd like to thank @TheAcademy , my wife Portia and , oh dear , there goes the orchestra . " <p/>Academy Award producers Craig Zadan and Neil Meron said in a statement : "We are thrilled to have Ellen DeGeneres host the Oscars . "

marked_doc: Chargers ' Jackson arrested on suspicion of DUI <p/>But after being arrested for suspicion DUI earlier this week , he has bigger worries than his <mark id="mark_id"> role </mark> in the Chargers ' offense . <p/>10News in San Diego is reporting that Jackson was arrested by the California Highway Patrol early Tuesday morning after failing sobriety tests . <p/>CHP Officer Brad Baehr said Jackson was on probation for a previous DUI arrest . <p/>The Chargers will not discipline Jackson at this time , but it 's almost a guarantee that the NFL will step in and suspend him for several games at the start of this season . <p/>However , unless you hear otherwise , Jackson will be playing in this week 's divisional playoff at Pittsburgh . <p/>Those in postseason leagues ( like our SalCap game or our 3-for-All game ) should avoid Jackson , but not just because of his recent troubles with the law . <p/>He was held without a catch for the second time all year last week , and this week he faces Pittsburgh 's top-ranked pass defense ( 156.9 yards allowed per game ) . <p/>In San Diego 's first meeting with the Steelers this season , Jackson was held to just two catches for 25 yards . <p/>Jackson 's recent run-in with the law effectively puts an end to his keeper value for next season .
