text: The arrest will not affect Jackson 's status for Sunday 's game .
marked_sentence: The arrest will not affect Jackson 's <mark id="mark_id"> status </mark> for Sunday 's game .
marked_doc: Jackson arrested on DUI charge <p/>Despite his arrest on suspicion of driving under the influence early yesterday , Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson will play in Sunday 's AFC divisional playoff game at Pittsburgh . <p/>Jackson , 25 , was driving east on state Route 52 near Interstate 805 just after 2:30 a.m. when he was pulled over for an observed traffic violation , California Highway Patrol Officer Brad Baehr said . <p/>Jackson faces the misdemeanor DUI allegation as well as charges that he was driving on probation for a prior DUI in June 2006 , Baehr said . <p/>The results of a blood test are pending . <p/>Jackson proffered his innocence in a statement released yesterday afternoon . <p/>`` This morning I was stopped by an officer , '' Jackson said in the statement . <p/>`` I do n't think any charges will be filed as a result of the stop . <p/>In the event they are , I look forward to clearing my name and proving my innocence . '' <p/>The arrest will not affect Jackson 's <mark id="mark_id"> status </mark> for Sunday 's game . <p/>The NFL 's collective bargaining agreement gives the league , not teams , authority to punish players for alcohol and substance abuses . <p/>Any discipline by the league would be meted out for the 2009 season , several sources said . <p/>A suspension certainly is possible . <p/>The NFL 's substance-abuse policy states : `` Discipline for a second or subsequent offense is likely to be a suspension , the duration of which may escalate for repeat offenses . '' <p/>Jared Allen , then with Kansas City , was suspended for the first four games of the 2007 season after being charged with DUI twice in one year . <p/>The NFL later reduced his suspension to two games . <p/>Chargers players had the day off yesterday . <p/>General Manager A.J. Smith issued the following statement on Jackson 's arrest : <p/>`` We 're aware of the off-the-field issue involving Vincent . <p/>Obviously , we 're disappointed . <p/>We take these issues very seriously . <p/>Moving forward , we will monitor the situation and have no further comment . '' <p/>Jackson was driving a 2008 GMC Sierra registered to him , Baehr said . <p/>He was booked into county jail and was released by 6 a.m. , Baehr said . <p/>Jackson , in his fourth season , caught a career-high 59 passes and led the team with 1,098 yards , also a career high . <p/>His seven receiving touchdowns were also a career best and second on the team . <p/>Earlier this week , Smith called Jackson a `` true professional '' and `` ultimate team player '' for how hard Jackson played even while not catching any passes . <p/>`` You win championships with players like Vincent Jackson , '' Smith said . <p/>The general manager has put an emphasis on character and avoiding off-the-field issues . <p/>The Chargers have not had any arrests become public this season and have been relatively trouble-free in recent years . <p/>In 2006 , linebacker Steve Foley was shot by an off-duty Coronado policeman who suspected Foley of driving under the influence . <p/>Foley pleaded guilty to misdemeanor drunken driving and was placed on five years ' probation . <p/>In July , he settled a lawsuit against the city of Coronado for $ 5.5 million . <p/>Jackson 's contract runs through 2009 , and he is among the hottest young receivers in the league . <p/>What becomes of this incident , combined with the previous DUI , could affect Jackson 's long-term future with the Chargers . <p/>Smith has let go a number of players who have had off-the-field troubles . <p/>While none was as productive or possessed the upside of Jackson , Smith did last February release tackle Shane Olivea just two years after signing Olivea to a contract that guaranteed him $ 9 million . <p/>Olivea later underwent treatment for an addiction to pain killers . <p/>`` You 're a Charger one year at a time , '' Smith has often said . <p/>Recently , speaking of the lack of incidents involving his players , Smith said , `` It 's very important if you want to be a Charger you do the right things on and off the field . '' <p/>The Chargers leave Friday for Pittsburgh , where they will face the Steelers at 1:45 p.m. Sunday .

marked_doc: Chargers receiver arrested for DUI <p/>San Diego Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson was arrested on suspicion of drunk driving on Tuesday morning , five days before a key NFL playoff game . <p/>Police apprehended Jackson at about 2:30 a.m. and booked him for the <mark id="mark_id"> misdemeanour </mark> before his release , making for a long night with a playoff looming on Sunday at Pittsburgh against the Steelers <p/>Jackson enjoyed the best of his four NFL seasons in 2008 with 59 catches for 1,098 yards and seven touchdowns . <p/>`` We 're aware of the off-the-field issue involving Vincent , '' Chargers general manager A.J. Butler said in a statement . <p/>`` Obviously we 're disappointed . <p/>We take these issues very seriously . <p/>Moving forward , we will monitor the situation . ''

text: Williams' DUI arrest just the latest for Chargers
marked_sentence: Williams' DUI arrest just the <mark id="mark_id"> latest </mark> for Chargers
marked_doc: http : / / www . utsandiego . com / news / 2009 / Feb / 04 / 1s4chargers222254 - williams - dui - arrest - just - latest - / <p/>Williams' DUI arrest just the <mark id="mark_id"> latest </mark> for Chargers <p/>Team has program to address problem <p/>2 A . M . FEB . 4 , 2009 <p/>Two years ago , the Chargers won an NFL special award for helping start a San Diego program by which players who've been imbibing can call a private number for a ride home , an alternative to driving under the influence . <p/>A former Chargers fullback , Lorenzo Neal , was among the co - founders of the “ Safe Ride Solutions ” program that since has been expanded to other NFL cities . <p/>Evidently , though , the drinking and driving problem hasn't been eradicated in San Diego . <p/>Sunday , for the second time in less than four weeks , a Chargers player was pulled over in the early - morning hours and arrested on suspicion of DUI . <p/>“ It's disappointing to hear about the issue involving Jamal Williams , ” said General Manager A . J . Smith in a news release issued by the team yesterday . <p/>“ We'll continue to monitor the situation and let the legal process run its course . ” <p/>Smith's statement served as the only comment from the Chargers . <p/>A request to interview club President Dean Spanos was declined by a spokesman . <p/>As it is , the Chargers are still awaiting the disposition of a similar case involving wide receiver Vincent Jackson , arrested Jan . 6 in Clairemont on suspicion of driving under the influence . <p/>Jackson , also facing charges of driving while on probation for a prior DUI , has an arraignment set for Feb . 17 in San Diego Superior Court . <p/>Williams , a three - time Pro Bowl nose tackle , was stopped for speeding westbound on state route 94 at approximately 1 : 30 a . m Sunday . <p/>Arrested by the CHP on suspicion of drunken driving , he was booked into county jail and later released on bond . <p/>Results of Williams' blood - alcohol test have not been released . <p/>“ These are just two more arrests that we've had , ” said Pat Hodgkin , local executive director of Mothers Against Drunk Driving ( MADD ) , noting that roughly 13 , 000 DUI convictions are issued every year in San Diego County . <p/>“ However , these are media - worthy professionals . <p/>These are individuals that not only youth looks up to , but adults look up to as well . <p/>They need to understand that they have an effect on people and a responsibility . ” <p/>The Chargers were involved in one of the most publicized and bizarre instances of a DUI stop in 2006 . <p/>Linebacker Steve Foley was shot three times by an off - duty Coronado police officer who followed Foley from downtown to the player's home in Poway . <p/>Foley , his career ended by the bullet wounds , later pleaded guilty to misdemeanor DUI . <p/>It was that case that prompted Gary Lawrence , a detective with the Northern Division of the San Diego Police Department , to ally with the Chargers in a program in which players who've been drinking would call “ Safe Ride Solutions ” and be driven home by an off - duty member of law enforcement . <p/>“ Anytime anybody's arrested for DUI , I get very disappointed , and not just when athletes are involved , ” said Lawrence yesterday . <p/>“ We're talking about a crime where people are killed or injured , a crime where people go to jail , and it's 100 percent preventable . ” <p/>Citing his company's confidentiality agreement with clients , Lawrence declined to discuss anything specific pertaining to the Chargers and their players . <p/>From its start with the team , though , the business has grown to include clients from other high - profile realms and put to work by other NFL franchises . <p/>In recognition of the program , the league gave the Chargers its Winston - Shell Award in 2007 for “ demonstrating commitment and dedication to developing unique and innovative ideas and solutions . ”
user_input:
Ann1 chose drive.01
Ann2 chose late.01

text: According to the California Highway Patrol , defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunken driving last weekend on a freeway outside downtown .
marked_sentence: <mark id="mark_id"> According to </mark> the California Highway Patrol , defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunken driving last weekend on a freeway outside downtown .
marked_doc: http : / / www . examiner . com / article / charger - jamal - williams - arrested - on - suspicion - of - dui <p/>Charger Jamal Williams arrested on suspicion of DUI <p/>February 5 , 2009 <p/>For the second time in less than a month , a member of the San Diego Chargers has been arrested on suspicion of drunk driving . <p/><mark id="mark_id"> According to </mark> the California Highway Patrol , defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunken driving last weekend on a freeway outside downtown . <p/>Williams , who was booked into county jail and later released on bail , did give a blood sample for a blood - alcohol test . <p/>However the results have not yet been divulged . <p/>Just last month , wide receiver Vincent Jackson , who was on probation for a previous DUI arrest , was pulled over for investigation of DUI . <p/>That arrest was just five days prior to the team's second - round playoff loss at Pittsburgh . <p/>In a statement released by the team , General Manager A . J . Smith noted , "It's disappointing to hear about the issue involving Jamal Williams . <p/>We'll continue to monitor the situation and let the legal process run its course . <p/>The Chargers have always been leaders and positive contributors to our community . <p/>We take our stature in the community very seriously . " <p/>While everyone is human , this appears to be yet another case of a professional athlete not using the matter that is provided to all of us between our ears . <p/>With more and more professional athletes making news these days , and oftentimes not for the right reasons , it is no wonder many people have trouble relating with the pros . <p/>Salaries that the common man generally doesn't see and an attitude of not caring in many cases is just part of the problem . <p/>While Williams and Jackson are presumed innocent , hopefully both of them learn a lesson . <p/>At the end of the day , their alleged actions not only impact them , but that family of four , the couple out on a date , or the guy returning home from his work shift . <p/>When you get behind the wheel of your car drunk , you could ruin more than just your life .

Ann1 chose say.01
Ann2 chose accord.01

text: Maurice Cheeks has been fired as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers following the club 's disappointing 9-14 start to the season .
marked_sentence: Maurice Cheeks has been <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers following the club 's disappointing 9-14 start to the season .
marked_doc: Maurice Cheeks has been <mark id="mark_id"> fired </mark> as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers following the club 's disappointing 9-14 start to the season . <p/>The Sixers have dropped their last three and are just 2-8 in their last ten after high expectations following an offseason that brought Elton Brand to Philly . <p/>Cheeks had signed an extension to his contract in September that was guaranteed through next year but the club felt they needed to make a change to reverse their fortunes . <p/>Assistant general manager Tony DiLeo will replace Cheeks as the interim head coach and he is expected to hold the position through the year . <p/>Philadelphia fans had expected the 76ers to be a contender this year following a playoff appearance one year ago and then adding Brand .

Ann1 chose fire.01
Ann2 chose fire.02

text: Billy King spun the 76ers' head coach revolving door again yesterday , pushing out Jim O'Brien after just one season and bringing in Maurice Cheeks , the popular former Sixers player and assistant coach , as O'Brien's replacement .
marked_sentence: Billy King <mark id="mark_id"> spun </mark> the 76ers' head coach revolving door again yesterday , pushing out Jim O'Brien after just one season and bringing in Maurice Cheeks , the popular former Sixers player and assistant coach , as O'Brien's replacement .
marked_doc: http : / / articles . philly . com / 2005 - 05 - 24 / news / 25441279 _ 1 _ sixers - samuel - dalembert - 10 - win - improvement <p/>Cheeks returns as Sixers' fixer Jim O'Brien was shown the door after a single tumultuous season . <p/>Posted : May 24 , 2005 <p/>Billy King <mark id="mark_id"> spun </mark> the 76ers' head coach revolving door again yesterday , pushing out Jim O'Brien after just one season and bringing in Maurice Cheeks , the popular former Sixers player and assistant coach , as O'Brien's replacement . <p/>Nearly three weeks after the Sixers ended their season , King decided to fire O'Brien , who still has two years and $8 million left on the contract he signed when he was hired by the Sixers on April 21 , 2004 . <p/>Cheeks , who was fired March 2 as head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers , is the fourth head coach since King took over as the team's president and general manager on May 26 , 2003 . <p/>That is the same date that Larry Brown resigned from the Sixers after six seasons , the last time coaching stability existed with the team . <p/>Cheeks was a second - round draft choice of the 76ers in 1978 and played for 11 seasons with the team . <p/>He was the point guard and floor leader of the Sixers' 1983 NBA title team . <p/>At a news conference last night at the Philadelphia College of Osteopathic Medicine , King said he had the support of Ed Snider , the chairman of Comcast - Spectacor , the team's owner , for his latest moves even though the Sixers will be paying ex - coaches Randy Ayers ( $2 million ) and O'Brien along with Cheeks next season . <p/>"In talking with Ed , we felt the main focus was that we want to make the right decisions and not let money be the factor , " King said . <p/>"We think we owe it to our fans and the city of Philadelphia to do that . " <p/>Cheeks , 48 , a four - time NBA all - star while with the Sixers , was fired from the Blazers , his first head coaching job , in the middle of his fourth season . <p/>He led the team to a 162 - 139 record . <p/>Two years ago , after Brown resigned , King looked to Cheeks to take over as Brown's successor . <p/>But the Trail Blazers rebuffed him three times , because Cheeks was still under contract to them . <p/>The Sixers then hired Ayers , who lasted 52 games before being replaced by Chris Ford . <p/>King said he decided on Saturday to fire O'Brien , and then checked with Cheeks to see if he'd be interested in the job . <p/>Cheeks said he would be , and King called him again yesterday and reached a deal after notifying O'Brien of his decision . <p/>Terms of the deal were not disclosed . <p/>When King hired O'Brien , he had called him a "perfect fit" for the job . <p/>O'Brien did lead the Sixers to a 43 - 39 record - a 10 - win improvement over the previous season - and a playoff berth and coached Allen Iverson to his fourth NBA scoring title . <p/>But in evaluating the season , King said he didn't think the Sixers were heading in the right direction . <p/>He had a problem with the team's style of play , which included reliance on the three - point basket and a defense that protected the paint but had trouble getting out on perimeter shooters . <p/>There was also talk that O'Brien was aloof and not communicative with his players . <p/>He did not start Samuel Dalembert , a developing young center , until the season's 19th game , and he did not play Willie Green with Iverson for much of the season's final four months because he felt that was a bad matchup defensively . <p/>King said that in his postseason meetings with players , "not one of them said they wouldn't play for Jim . . . <p/>that they'd all come back ready to go and try to go further in the playoffs . " <p/>But other things bothered him . <p/>King said he didn't want to make a snap decision when the season ended on May 3 , the day that the Detroit Pistons eliminated the Sixers from the playoffs . <p/>He talked to his management team , went on vacation for a week , then made his decision on Saturday . <p/>"In the interview process with Jim , there were a lot of things that we talked about , " King said . <p/>"But in watching the season , evaluating our young players' development and evaluating our style of play , it wasn't something I was comfortable with . " <p/>Reached by telephone yesterday , O'Brien declined to comment . <p/>"I'm not going to have any discussion about this , " he said . <p/>King said that when he broke the news yesterday to O'Brien , "He asked why , and I told him that I just felt there were some things that took place that I don't think will change and we're going to make a change . <p/>He said , 'Thank you . ' " <p/>Snider , who attended King's news conference , said he backed King . <p/>"I really don't question Billy at all , " he said . <p/>"I know what went on in the process when he made this decision , as well as the decision to hire Jim O'Brien . <p/>I've supported his moves , and I still do . " <p/>O'Brien was excited to come back to Philadelphia because of his roots in the city . <p/>Cheeks , who is expected to speak at a press conference today , is excited to be coming back to Philadelphia because of all the success he enjoyed here as a player , followed by seven seasons as an assistant coach . <p/>"Mo is family , " King said . <p/>"Mo bleeds 76ers . <p/>He bleeds Philadelphia . " <p/>He is still the franchise's all - time leader in assists and steals . <p/>Cheeks also played with San Antonio , New York , Atlanta and New Jersey before retiring in 1993 . <p/>Cheeks returned to the Sixers in 1994 as an assistant coach and stayed for seven seasons until the Trail Blazers hired him as head coach on June 27 , 2001 . <p/>Under Cheeks' guidance , the Blazers made the playoffs in 2002 and 2003 , but did not get out of the first round . <p/>They missed the postseason in 2004 , breaking a streak of 21 consecutive years in the playoffs , and were wracked by dissension . <p/>"I look at Mo Cheeks and I know Mo Cheeks , " King said . <p/>"If players have problems with Mo Cheeks , then there's got to be something wrong with those players . " <p/>Under O'Brien , the former head coach of the Boston Celtics , Iverson moved from shooting guard to point guard and responded with an MVP - caliber season , winning his fourth NBA scoring title . <p/>But O'Brien is gone now . <p/>Cheeks is in . <p/>And King knows he's being held accountable . <p/>"I look in the mirror every day , " King said . <p/>"I'm not somebody that's above scrutiny , but I think I try to do the best I can and make the best decisions . "
user_input:
Ann1 chose fire.02
Ann2 chose spin.01

text: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise history .
marked_sentence: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise <mark id="mark_id"> history </mark> .
marked_doc: http : / / sports . espn . go . com / nba / news / story ? id=2066717 <p/>Mo Cheeks will take over as new coach <p/>Updated : May 24 , 2005 , 3 : 23 PM ET <p/>Maurice Cheeks is running the show again for the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season , the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks , one of the most popular players in franchise <mark id="mark_id"> history </mark> . <p/>"Mo is family . <p/>Mo bleeds 76ers . He bleeds Philadelphia , " team president Billy King said . <p/>Cheeks will be introduced as Philadelphia's 21st head coach at a Tuesday news conference . <p/>Philadelphia is certainly banking on the former point guard to have a happier homecoming than O'Brien , a Philadelphia native who played for Saint Joseph's . <p/>O'Brien's stubbornness and seemingly unwavering belief in a system that didn't fit his players cost him his job despite a 43 - 39 record and a return to the playoffs . <p/>"I just felt the direction we were going and the overall play wasn't where we wanted to go , " King said . <p/>O'Brien just finished the first year of a three - year deal that included an option and paid him about $4 million a year . <p/>O'Brien , though , was not very popular with his players - - most notably former All - Star Chris Webber - - who often complained about their roles . <p/>King said after the Sixers were eliminated in the first round of the playoffs by Detroit that he planned to bring O'Brien back . <p/>After meeting with his players and other members of management , King had a change of heart and decided over the weekend he had to make a change . <p/>Certainly , King knows a thing or two about making changes - - Cheeks will be the fifth Sixers coach in four years under his watch . <p/>Larry Brown left for Detroit following the 2002 - 03 season , and assistant Randy Ayers was promoted and fired 52 games into the 2003 - 04 season before he was replaced by Chris Ford . <p/>"I knew this thing was coming , and it wasn't an easy thing for anybody , " Brown said from Miami before coaching the Pistons in the Eastern Conference finals . <p/>"Knowing Billy , it's not easy to let a coach go . <p/>His relationship with Randy was pretty strong . <p/>I think it was hard for him to let Chris go . <p/>He was excited about having Jimmy , but I don't think it ever gets easy . " <p/>Cheeks was one of the most popular 76ers from 1978 - 89 and played on Philadelphia's last championship team in 1983 . <p/>He also spent seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers , was part of the staff under Brown when they went to the NBA Finals in 2001 and developed a strong bond with Allen Iverson . <p/>Cheeks was fired March 2 after nearly four seasons as coach of the Trail Blazers . <p/>He had a 162 - 139 record in Portland , the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history . <p/>Cheeks guided the team to the playoffs his first two seasons , but the players hardly made Cheeks' tenure easy - - on or off the court . <p/>The team was nicknamed the "Jail Blazers" after several brushes with the law , many of them involving marijuana possession . <p/>"If players have problems with Mo Cheeks . . . then there's got to be something wrong with those players , " King said . <p/>But Cheeks' return to the city where he was a four - time All - Star shouldn't come as a surprise . <p/>The Trail Blazers turned down Philadelphia's request to speak to Cheeks as a possible replacement for Brown , but the former point guard always remained popular with Philly fans and was at the top of the Sixers' short list to take over for Ford . <p/>Now , they'll get their wish . <p/>"We do not want to change coaches [ again ] , " Sixers chairman Ed Snider said . <p/>"We've seen enough coaches . " <p/>The Sixers will pay Ayers , O'Brien and Cheeks next season . <p/>"I don't think it's something we're very proud of , but I don't think it reflects poorly , " Snider said . <p/>O'Brien is the son - in - law of Hall of Fame coach Jack Ramsay . <p/>He led the Sixers to a 10 - win improvement from a year ago and they returned to the playoffs , largely on the back of a healthy , happy Iverson . <p/>While O'Brien avoided public spats with Iverson , he did not have the full support of the rest of the team . <p/>Some of the younger players , like Samuel Dalembert and Willie Green , felt they did not develop like they should have under O'Brien and were unsure about their roles . <p/>"In looking at the development of some of them , yeah , I wasn't pleased , " King said . <p/>The Sixers also failed to really understand O'Brien's defense , a sticking point even in the postseason . <p/>"Some of the criteria on our defense wasn't there , " King said . <p/>Cheeks , who once famously came to the rescue of a 13 - year - old girl who forgot the words to the national anthem before a playoff game , now hopes to bail out his former team and bring them another championship . <p/>"Mo has played this game here in Philadelphia , won a championship here in Philadelphia , understands players , understands defenses , understands the way I think we want to play , " King said .

text: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they went on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
marked_sentence: But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they <mark id="mark_id"> went </mark> on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach .
marked_doc: Not because Mo Cheeks was long for the job with the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>Like all coaches not in the upper stratosphere of the coaching hierarchy -- your Phil Jacksons and Gregg Popoviches -- he was only as good as his last 10-game stretch , only as secure as how well his star was playing . <p/>But the 76ers , while underachieving at 9-14 when Cheeks was fired Saturday morning , were not an embarassment when they <mark id="mark_id"> went </mark> on the court , not a disjointed bunch that clearly was no longer listening to or playing for its coach . <p/>This was n't P.J. Carlesimo ( Oklahoma City ) or Eddie Jordan ( Washington ) , whose team 's putrid won-loss records sank any chance they had of survival . <p/>This was n't Sam Mitchell ( Toronto ) , whose differences of opinion with his general manager about his team 's personnel were too big to overcome . <p/>This was n't Randy Wittman ( Minnesota ) , whose fan base was staying away in droves as the paying public grew indifferent to the on-court product . <p/>The timing of this move by team president and general manager Ed Stefanski was a head-scratcher . <p/>`` It 's not 100 percent on the coach , '' a source with knowledge of the 76ers ' thinking said Saturday afternoon . <p/>`` But at the same time , we did n't seem to have a plan . '' <p/>Stefanski named assistant general manager Tony DiLeo coach for the rest of the season . <p/>DiLeo has a good reputation as a coach , spending time over the last two decades on the Sixers ' bench as an assistant and in Europe as a head coach . <p/>But unless circumstances change dramatically , Jordan -- who became close with Stefanski while both were in New Jersey earlier this decade -- will be the odds-on favorite to get the job permanantly . <p/>Many league execs still think quite highly of Jordan , and none of the players who matter in Washington threw Jordan under the bus after he was fired . <p/>Cheeks ' coaching moves have frequently been criticized over the years , both in Philadelphia and in Portland . <p/>But he lost his job this time not only because of Xs and Os , but because so many of the 76ers ' players that blossomed under him last season , including center Sam Dalembert , forward Andre Iguodala and guard Lou Williams , struggled to get going this season . <p/>And the moves Cheeks made , like benching second-year forward Thaddeus Young and elevating guard Willie Green , have n't produced enough dividends . <p/>`` Ed just was n't seeing any progress , '' the source said , and Stefanski expected more from a team that had signed free agent Elton Brand to an $ 82 million deal and re-signed core players Iguodala and Williams for $ 80 million and $ 25 million , respectively . <p/>`` We were n't progressing at the rate [ Stefanski ] thought we should , and he thought it was time for a move , '' the source said . <p/>Yet Stefanski can not escape criticism , either . <p/>Bringing Brand in was the signing coup of the NBA offseason , to be sure . <p/>But in doing that , Stefanski changed the team 's footprint . <p/>The Sixers are still a very good transition team . <p/>But when the game slows down , having to cater to Brand leaves the lane clogged . <p/>Last season , Iguodala , Young and Williams had driving room when Philly ran its halfcourt sets , and Dalembert showed occasional decent low-post play . <p/>But now , Brand is the man in the paint , forcing everyone else out on the perimeter . <p/>Left to fend for himself on the weakside , Dalembert 's numbers have plummeted , and Williams has just begun to play well . <p/>Brand is recovered from the Achilles ' injury that kept him out of all but eight games last season with the Clippers , but he 's been slowed by a bad hamstring , and his offensive numbers ( 15.9 points , a career-low .436 from the floor ) have been unspectactular . <p/>No matter what the stats say , Philly looks and plays slower this season . <p/>And Stefanski did n't get a big-time shooter who could stretch the court and take pressure off of Brand inside . <p/>Veterans Donyell Marshall and Kareem Rush , signed later in the summer by Philly , do n't strike much fear into opposing teams . <p/>The result is Philly 's 93.3 scoring average , 28th in the league ( only Charlotte and Oklahoma City have scored 100 points fewer times than Philadelphia 's six ) , and .314 percentage behind the three-point line , 26th in the league . <p/>`` Everybody zones them , '' an Eastern Conference executive said Saturday . <p/>The Sixers had just scored one of their more impressive victories eight days ago , rallying from a double-digit deficit in the second half to win on the road at Detroit . <p/>True , they had bad losses early to the Bobcats and Timberwolves , and lost a home-and-home to the Cavaliers on Wednesday and Friday . <p/>But last we checked , Cleveland was 20-3 , owner of an 11-game win streak and the only remaining undefeated team at home this season . <p/>The Cavs are rolling , and losing to them is no embarassment . <p/>Another league source with knowledge of the team 's thinking said Saturday that the Cleveland losses played no role in Cheeks 's firing . <p/>Cheeks received his second one-year contract extension in less than a year last September , taking him through the 2009-10 season . <p/>While Stefanski did n't hire Cheeks ( that was former president Billy King , whom Stefanski replaced early last season ) , Stefanski and Cheeks had quickly established a solid , working relationship with one another . <p/>Cheeks quickly acquiesced last year when Stefanski asked him to give more time to the team 's younger players , getting Young and young vets Rodney Carney and Williams bigger minutes . <p/>The transition transformed the team , as the 76ers went on a 19-7 run last spring , turning opponents over and becoming deadly in transition . <p/>They rode their hot streak into the playoffs , where they stretched Detroit to six games before succumbing in the first round . <p/>They were n't a finished product , though , and it was no secret that Brand was Stefanski 's target , just as he 'd been King 's ultimate target . <p/>After a brief dalliance with Atlanta free agent Josh Smith , So Stefanski cleared as much cap room as possible , sending Carney and center Calvin Booth to Minnesota , and then struck , getting Brand to spurn his former team , the Clippers , as well as the Warriors , for the Sixers ' $ 80 million offer -- the `` Philly Max , '' as Brand later called it . <p/>After keeping Iguodala and Williams , all the heat was on Cheeks . <p/>Saturday , he became the latest coach -- one-sixth of the league 's head men already gone in little more than five weeks -- to succumb to the pyre .

Ann2 chose go.01

text: Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced today that Jim O'Brien has been relieved of his duties as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers .
marked_sentence: Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced today that Jim O'Brien has been relieved of his <mark id="mark_id"> duties </mark> as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers .
marked_doc: http : / / www . insidehoops . com / obrien - cheeks - 052305 . shtml <p/>Philadelphia 76ers Fire Coach Jim O'Brien , Hire Maurice Cheeks <p/>May 23 , 2005 <p/>Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced today that Jim O'Brien has been relieved of his <mark id="mark_id"> duties </mark> as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>No decision has been reached on O'Brien's staff at this time . <p/>O'Brien was hired as the 20th coach of the 76ers on April 21 , 2004 and posted a record of 43 - 39 in 2004 - 05 . <p/>Overall , in five seasons as an NBA head coach , O'Brien recorded a mark of 182 - 158 ( . 535 ) , including a record of 139 - 119 ( . 539 ) with the Boston Celtics from 2000 - 04 . <p/>O'Brien has served on the coaching staffs at seven different universities , including head coaching positions at Wheeling Jesuit College ( 1982 - 87 ) and University of Dayton ( 1989 - 94 ) . <p/>He owns a 135 - 156 ( . 464 ) record at the collegiate level in 10 seasons as a head coach . <p/>Also today , Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced that Maurice Cheeks has been hired as the 21st head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers . <p/>Cheeks arrives in Philadelphia after three - plus seasons as head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers . <p/>He recorded a mark of 162 - 139 ( . 538 ) in Portland , the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history . <p/>During his time in Portland , the Blazers reached the NBA Playoffs twice , and his 2002 - 03 squad tied for second in the Pacific Division with a 50 - 32 record . <p/>He joined the Blazers on June 27 , 2001 , after serving seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers . <p/>Cheeks worked under head coaches John Lucas ( 1994 - 96 ) , Johnny Davis ( 1996 - 97 ) , and Larry Brown ( 1997 - 2001 ) . <p/>In 2000 - 01 under Brown , Cheeks helped guide the 76ers to a record of 56 - 26 ( . 683 ) and a spot in the NBA Finals . <p/>Cheeks , 48 , logged an impressive 15 - year NBA career , spending 11 seasons in Philadelphia . <p/>The four - time All - Star ( 1983 , '86 , '87 , '88 ) helped guide the 76ers to 10 playoff appearances , including a World Championship in 1983 . <p/>In 133 career playoff games , he averaged 14 . 4 points , 6 . 9 assists , and 3 . 4 rebounds while shooting 51 . 2 percent from the field . <p/>Cheeks is also a five - time NBA All - Defensive Team honoree . <p/>The native of Chicago , Ill . , he averaged 11 . 1 points , 6 . 7 assists and 2 . 1 steals in 1 , 101 career games while shooting 52 . 3 percent from the field and 79 . 3 percent from the charity stripe . <p/>He retired in 1993 as the league's all - time leader in steals , and was fifth on the career assists list at that time . <p/>Currently , he ranks fourth in steals and eighth in assists all - time . <p/>Cheeks had his No . 10 76ers jersey retired on Feb . 6 , 1995 . <p/>The 1978 product of West Texas State was a four - year starter and three - time team MVP in college . <p/>He finished his collegiate career third on the Buffalos' all - time scoring list , averaging 16 . 8 points per game . <p/>Cheeks was selected in the second round of the 1978 NBA Draft ( 36th overall pick ) by the 76ers .

text: The Eastern Conference standings have claimed another coach , with Philadelphia 76ers head man Maurice Cheeks joining the ever-growing list of coaches who are no longer employed .

marked_doc: The Eastern Conference standings have <mark id="mark_id"> claimed </mark> another coach , with Philadelphia 76ers head man Maurice Cheeks joining the ever-growing list of coaches who are no longer employed . <p/>The 2008-09 season was supposed to be a good one for the Sixers , who claimed the summer 's top free agent prize in Elton Brand and then assured that their big three would be together long-term by re-signing Anre Iguodala . <p/>Unfortunately , it has n't played out that way to date . <p/>Currently sitting at 9-14 on the season , the only thing stopping Philly from being complete buried in the standings is that so many Eastern Conference teams are struggling , as well . <p/>Despite their poor start and their current three-game losing streak - likely to end tonight as the team takes on the Wizards - the Sixers are still just two games in the loss column behind the eighth seed in the East . <p/>Cheeks marks the third Eastern Conference head coach to get fired this season , following in the footsteps of the Toronto Raptors ' Sam Mitchell and the Washington Wizards ' Eddie Jordan . <p/>Cheeks will be succeeded by Assistant GM Tony DiLeo .

marked_doc: http : / / sports . espn . go . com / nba / news / story ? id=2115562 <p/>Agent says Sixers to sign Dalembert to six - year deal <p/>July 25 , 2005 , 12 : 18 AM ET <p/>Samuel Dalembert agreed to a six year deal with the Philadelphia 76ers on Saturday , his agent Marc Cornstein , told ESPN . com . <p/>Cornstein refused to disclose the amount of the contract , but it's believed to be worth between $60 million to $70 million , based on previous negotiations . <p/>The signing came just one day before Dalembert was set to get on a plane and visit the Atlanta Hawks , who had the money under the cap to pay him a maximum five - year , $70 million offer . <p/>Of the three top big men on the market , Dalembert was the center with the most upside . <p/>He has great range and is athletic , with great shot blocking instincts . <p/>He's shown he can be a volume rebounder and his offensive game is emerging . <p/>He was very inconsistent at times this season , but in the playoffs against the Detroit Pistons , he played the part of a franchise center . <p/>The Sixers made a power move this offseason , firing head coach Jim O'Brien , who wasn't a Dalembert fan , and replacing him with Mo Cheeks , who <mark id="mark_id"> is </mark> . <p/>Philly let it be known that O'Brien was fired , in part , because the Sixers are committed to Dalembert . <p/>This is the third deal for the Sixers this summer . <p/>They also reached six - year deals with Kyle Korver for $25 million and with Willie Green for about $20 million .
